content.description: If you consider yourself a slab-aficionado, then this is a must-do.  Climb the slab via a couple of crimps and lots of smears to a pause near the top.  Commit and finish it up.
content.location: Hull boulder, right next to the large tree, north side of the boulder

content.description: Start in the horizontal crack and reach up to an awkward sidepull. Gaston the good edge up left, get your feet high to move up the sloping edge to make a move for the arete. Top out on the sub summit
content.protection: Lots of pads and spotters, crux is up over rocky landing.
content.location: SW corner of the Hull boulder, just right of arete.

content.description: A tamer version of the Titanic.  Climb the right side of the slab past an angling crack to a flake then mantle to the top.
content.location: Right of the Titanic...look for the large tree.

content.description:
The namesake anvil feature was knocked down by a falling tree during the fires here a couple years ago however it still climbs pretty well without it.

Stand start about halfway up the side of the boulder on good left hand undercling and right hand sidepull. Make some powerful and tensiony moves to gain a nice sloper and then figure out a way to reach the slopey lip and hidden jug.
content.protection: There is a pretty substantial log landing build up under this making it pretty safe with a few pads.
content.location: The starboard side (climbers left) of the ships bow feature of The Hull boulder.
